intro: Daucus quarrei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved carrot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure called a schizocarp, typical of the family. Daucus quarrei is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is considered a herbaceous perennial.
